description: Create, edit and manage customer support tickets.
steps: Navigate to Zendesk Support Admin interface at Admin > Channels > API.
The page lets you view, add, or delete tokens.

blocks.name: getIncrementalTickets
blocks.description: Returns the tickets that changed since the start time. The results include tickets that were updated by the system. The endpoint can return records where the updated_at time is earlier than the start_date time. The reason is that the updated_at value is updated only if the ticket update generates a ticket event. Otherwise, the timestamp of the previous update carries over.

blocks.name: getIncrementalTicketsEvents
blocks.description: Returns a stream of changes that occurred on tickets. Each event is tied to an update on a ticket and contains all the fields that were updated in that change. You can include comments in the event stream by using the comment_events sideload. See Sideloading below. If you don't specify the sideload, any comment present in the ticket update is described only by Boolean comment_present and comment_public object properties in the event's child_events array. The comment itself is not included.

blocks.name: getIncrementalOrganizations
blocks.description: Returns the organizations that changed since the start time.

blocks.name: getIncrementalUsers
blocks.description: Returns the users that changed since the start time.

blocks.name: getJobStatuses
blocks.description: This shows the current statuses for background jobs running.

blocks.name: getTickets
blocks.description: Tickets are ordered chronologically by created date, from oldest to newest. The first ticket listed may not be the absolute oldest ticket in your account due to ticket archiving. To get a list of all tickets in your account, use the Incremental Ticket Export endpoint.

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Possible values are assignee, assignee.name, created_at, group, id, locale, requester, requester.name, status, subject, updated_at

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

blocks.name: getSingleTicket
blocks.description: Returns a number of ticket properties, but not the ticket comments. To get the comments, use List Comments.

blocks.name: getTicketsByIds
blocks.description: Accepts a list of ticket ids to return. This endpoint will return up to 100 tickets records.

args.name: comment
args.info: A comment object that describes the problem, incident, question, or task. todo JSON

args.name: requesterId
args.info: The numeric ID of the user asking for support through the ticket

args.name: submitterId
args.info: The numeric ID of the user submitting the ticket

args.name: assigneeId
args.info: The numeric ID of the agent to assign the ticket to

args.name: groupId
args.info: The numeric ID of the group to assign the ticket to

args.name: collaboratorIds
args.info: An array of the numeric IDs of agents or end-users to CC on the ticket. An email notification is sent to them when the ticket is created

args.name: collaborators
args.info: An array of numeric IDs, emails, or objects containing name and email properties. An email notification is sent to them when the ticket is created. Example: '[562,'someone@example.com',{'name':'Someone Else','email':'else@example.com'}]'

args.name: type
args.info: Allowed values are problem, incident, question, or task

args.name: priority
args.info: Allowed values are urgent, high, normal, or low

args.name: status
args.info: Allowed values are new, open, pending, hold, solved or closed. Is set to new if status is not specified

args.name: tags
args.info: List of tags to add to the ticket

args.name: externalId
args.info: An ID to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records

args.name: forumTopicId
args.info: The numeric ID of the topic the ticket originated from, if any

args.name: problemId
args.info: For tickets of type 'incident', the numeric ID of the problem the incident is linked to, if any

args.name: dueAt
args.info: For tickets of type 'task', the due date of the task. Accepts the ISO 8601 date format (yyyy-mm-dd)

args.name: ticketFormId
args.info: (Enterprise only) The id of the ticket form to render for the ticket

args.name: customFields
args.info: An array of the custom fields of the ticket. See below for details

args.name: viaFollowupSourceId
args.info: The id of a closed ticket for a follow-up ticket.

blocks.name: createTickets
blocks.description: Create many tickets from JSON file

args.name: tickets
args.info: JSON contents array of tickets data. Example [{ticketData1}, {ticketData2}]. TicketData the same as when creating one ticket.

args.name: externalId
args.info: An id you can use to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records

args.name: type
args.info: The type of this ticket, i.e. "problem", "incident", "question" or "task"

args.name: subject
args.info: The value of the subject field for this ticket

args.name: rawSubject
args.info: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "subject" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

args.name: priority
args.info: Priority, defines the urgency with which the ticket should be addressed: "urgent", "high", "normal", "low"

args.name: recipient
args.info: The original recipient e-mail address of the ticket

args.name: requesterId
args.info: The user who requested this ticket

args.name: submitterId
args.info: The user who submitted the ticket; The submitter always becomes the author of the first comment on the ticket.

args.name: assigneeId
args.info: What agent is currently assigned to the ticket

args.name: organizationId
args.info: The organization of the requester. You can only specify the ID of an organization associated with the requester. See Organization Memberships

args.name: groupId
args.info: The group this ticket is assigned to

args.name: collaboratorIds
args.info: Who are currently CC'ed on the ticket

args.name: forumTopicId
args.info: The topic this ticket originated from, if any

args.name: problemId
args.info: The problem this incident is linked to, if any

args.name: dueAt
args.info: If this is a ticket of type "task" it has a due date. Due date format uses ISO 8601 format.

args.name: tags
args.info: The array of tags applied to this ticket

args.name: customFields
args.info: The custom fields of the ticket

args.name: ticketFormId
args.info: The id of the ticket form to render for this ticket - only applicable for enterprise accounts

args.name: brandId
args.info: The id of the brand this ticket is associated with - only applicable for enterprise accounts

blocks.name: updateTickets
blocks.description: Update tickets by its id (in each obj in list)

args.name: params
args.info: Json file with params to update. Example [param1, param2]. Each param is object like params in updateSingleTicket

blocks.name: updateTicketsByIds
blocks.description: Update many tickets with the same information

args.name: externalId
args.info: An id you can use to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records

args.name: type
args.info: The type of this ticket, i.e. "problem", "incident", "question" or "task"

args.name: subject
args.info: The value of the subject field for this ticket

args.name: rawSubject
args.info: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "subject" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

args.name: priority
args.info: Priority, defines the urgency with which the ticket should be addressed: "urgent", "high", "normal", "low"

args.name: recipient
args.info: The original recipient e-mail address of the ticket

args.name: requesterId
args.info: The user who requested this ticket

args.name: submitterId
args.info: The user who submitted the ticket; The submitter always becomes the author of the first comment on the ticket.

args.name: assigneeId
args.info: What agent is currently assigned to the ticket

args.name: organizationId
args.info: The organization of the requester. You can only specify the ID of an organization associated with the requester. See Organization Memberships

args.name: groupId
args.info: The group this ticket is assigned to

args.name: collaboratorIds
args.info: Who are currently CC'ed on the ticket

args.name: forumTopicId
args.info: The topic this ticket originated from, if any

args.name: problemId
args.info: The problem this incident is linked to, if any

args.name: dueAt
args.info: If this is a ticket of type "task" it has a due date. Due date format uses ISO 8601 format.

args.name: tags
args.info: The array of tags applied to this ticket

args.name: customFields
args.info: The custom fields of the ticket

args.name: ticketFormId
args.info: The id of the ticket form to render for this ticket - only applicable for enterprise accounts

args.name: brandId
args.info: The id of the brand this ticket is associated with - only applicable for enterprise accounts

blocks.name: markSingleTicketAsSpam
blocks.description: Mark Ticket as Spam and Suspend Requester

blocks.name: markTicketsAsSpam
blocks.description: Mark Tickets as Spam and Suspend Requester

blocks.name: mergeTickets
blocks.description: Merges one or more tickets into the {id} target ticket.

args.name: targetComment
args.info: Private comment to add to the target ticket

args.name: sourceComment
args.info: Private comment to add to the source ticket

blocks.name: autocompleteTicketsProblems
blocks.description: Returns tickets whose type is 'Problem' and whose subject contains the string specified in the text parameter.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

blocks.name: removeCommentAttachment
blocks.description: Redaction allows you to permanently remove attachments from an existing comment on a ticket. Once removed from a comment, the attachment is replaced with a placeholder 'redacted.txt' file. Note that redaction is permanent. It is not possible to undo redaction or see what was removed. Once a ticket is closed, redacting its attachments is no longer possible.

blocks.name: uploadFiles
blocks.description: Adding multiple attachments to the same upload is handled by splitting requests and passing the API token received from the first request to each subsequent request. The token is valid for 3 days. Note: Even if private attachments are enabled in the Zendesk Support instance, uploaded files are visible to any authenticated user at the content_URL specified in the JSON response until the upload token is consumed. Once an attachment is associated with a ticket or post, visibility is restricted to users with access to the ticket or post with the attachment.

args.name: uploadToken
args.info: Upload token. Use it when need to upload more then 1 file and associate with token

args.name: uploadToken
args.info: Upload token. Use it when need to upload more then 1 file and associate with token

blocks.name: getSatisfactionRatings
blocks.description: List all received satisfaction rating requests ever issued for your account.

blocks.name: getSatisfactionRatingReasons
blocks.description: Return list all reasons for an account

blocks.name: getSatisfactionRatingReason
blocks.description: Return list all reasons for an account

blocks.name: createSatisfactionRating
blocks.description: Create a rating for solved tickets, or for tickets that were previously solved and then reopened.

args.name: requesterId
args.info: The id of ticket requester submitting the rating. Default owner of apiToken

blocks.name: getTicketAudits
blocks.description: Lists the audits for a specified ticket.

blocks.name: getTicketSingleAudits
blocks.description: Get audit for a specified ticket by audit ID

blocks.name: removeWordFromTicketComment
blocks.description: Permanently removes words or strings from a ticket comment. Specify the string to redact in an object with a text property. Example: {"text": "credit-card-number"}. The characters of the word or string are replaced by the ▇ symbol. Redaction is permanent. You can't undo the redaction or see what was removed. Once a ticket is closed, you can no longer redact strings from its comments.

blocks.name: skipTicket
blocks.description: Record a new skip for the current user

blocks.name: getSingleMetric
blocks.description: Get ticket metric by metric ID

blocks.name: getSingleTicketMetric
blocks.description: Get ticket metric by ticket ID

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

blocks.name: getRequestListByStatus
blocks.description: Get list of requests by status

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc, desc. Defaults to asc

blocks.name: deleteMembership
blocks.description: Immediately removes a user from a group and schedules a job to unassign all working tickets that are assigned to the given user and group combination.

blocks.name: deleteMemberships
blocks.description: Immediately removes users from groups and schedules a job to unassign all working tickets that are assigned to the given user and group combinations.

args.name: permissionSet
args.info: For custom roles in the Enterprise plan. You can only filter by one role id per request

blocks.name: getUsersByExternalIds
blocks.description: Get Users by External Id list

args.name: verified
args.info: True - if you need to create users without sending out a verification email.

args.name: role
args.info: If you need to create agents with a specific role, the role parameter only accepts three possible values: "end-user", "agent", "admin".

args.name: customRoleId
args.info: Therefore you will need to set role to "agent" as well as add a new parameter called "custom_role_id" and give it the actual desired role ID from your Zendesk Support account.

args.name: alias
args.info: An alias displayed to end users

args.name: details
args.info: Any details you want to store about the user, such as an address

args.name: externalId
args.info: A unique id you can specify for the user

args.name: moderator
args.info: Designates whether the user has forum moderation capabilities

args.name: notes
args.info: Any notes you want to store about the user

args.name: onlyPrivateComments
args.info: True if the user can only create private comments

args.name: organizationId
args.info: The id of the organization the user is associated with

args.name: defaultGroupId
args.info: The id of the user's default group. *Can only be set on create, not on update

args.name: phone
args.info: The user's primary phone number. See Phone Number below

args.name: restrictedAgent
args.info: If the agent has any restrictions; false for admins and unrestricted agents, true for other agents

args.name: signature
args.info: The user's signature. Only agents and admins can have signatures

args.name: suspended
args.info: If the agent is suspended. Tickets from suspended users are also suspended, and these users cannot sign in to the end user portal

args.name: tags
args.info: The user's tags. Only present if your account has user tagging enabled

args.name: ticketRestriction
args.info: Specifies which tickets the user has access to. Possible values are: "organization", "groups", "assigned", "requested", null

args.name: timeZone
args.info: The user's time zone. See Time Zone below

args.name: userId
args.info: This user will be merged into the existing user provided in the target user id param. Any two arbitrary users can be merged.

args.name: targetUserId
args.info: User ID to which will be merged

blocks.name: autocompleteUsers
blocks.description: Returns an array of users whose name starts with the value specified in the name paramater. It only returns users with no foreign identities.

args.name: name
args.info: The text from which the name begins

blocks.name: setUserPassword
blocks.description: An admin can set a user's password only if the setting is enabled under Settings > Security > Global. The setting is off by default. Only the account owner can access and change this setting in Zendesk Support.

blocks.name: updatePassword
blocks.description: You can only change your own password. Nobody can change the password of another user because it requires knowing the user's existing password. However, an admin can set a new password for another user without knowing the existing password. See "Set a User's Password" above.

blocks.name: getPasswordRequirements
blocks.description: Get a list of password requirements

blocks.name: getIdentities
blocks.description: Returns all user identities for a given user id.

blocks.name: getSingleIdentity
blocks.description: Shows the identity with the given id.

blocks.name: createIdentity
blocks.description: Adds a new identity to a user's profile. An agent can add an identity to any user profile.

args.name: type
args.info: New identity: email, twitter, facebook or google

args.name: verified
args.info: If the identity has been verified

args.name: undeliverableCount
args.info: The number of times a non-delivery response was received at that address (maximum 50)

blocks.name: createSelfIdentity
blocks.description: Add an identity to their own user profile

args.name: type
args.info: New identity: email, twitter, facebook or google

args.name: primary
args.info: If the identity is the primary identity. *Writable only when creating, not when updating. Use the makeIdentifyPrimary endpoint instead

args.name: verified
args.info: If the identity has been verified

args.name: undeliverableCount
args.info: The number of times a non-delivery response was received at that address (maximum 50)

blocks.name: updateIdentity
blocks.description: This endpoint allows you to set the specified identity as verified (but you cannot unverify a verified identity and update the value of the specified identity

args.name: name
args.info: Identity name. Example: email, twitter, verified etc. You cant change primary identity value. For more details look at getIdentities

args.name: undeliverableCount
args.info: The number of times a non-delivery response was received at that address (maximum 50)

blocks.name: makeIdentityPrimary
blocks.description: Sets the specified identity as primary. Only fort Agents

blocks.name: makeMyIdentityPrimary
blocks.description: Sets the own identity as primary. For verified end users

blocks.name: verifyIdentity
blocks.description: Sets the specified identity as verified.

blocks.name: requestUserVerification
blocks.description: Sends the user a verification email with a link to verify ownership of the email address.

blocks.name: deleteIdentity
blocks.description: Deletes the identity for a given user.

blocks.name: getCustomRoles
blocks.description: Get custom roles. Available only in Enterprise plan and Professional plan with the Light Agents add-on

args.name: verified
args.info: True - if you need to create users without sending out a verification email.

args.name: role
args.info: If you need to create agents with a specific role, the role parameter only accepts three possible values: "end-user", "agent", "admin".

args.name: customRoleId
args.info: Therefore you will need to set role to "agent" as well as add a new parameter called "custom_role_id" and give it the actual desired role ID from your Zendesk Support account.

args.name: alias
args.info: An alias displayed to end users

args.name: details
args.info: Any details you want to store about the user, such as an address

args.name: externalId
args.info: A unique id you can specify for the user

args.name: moderator
args.info: Designates whether the user has forum moderation capabilities

args.name: notes
args.info: Any notes you want to store about the user

args.name: onlyPrivateComments
args.info: True if the user can only create private comments

args.name: organizationId
args.info: The id of the organization the user is associated with

args.name: phone
args.info: The user's primary phone number. See Phone Number below

args.name: restrictedAgent
args.info: If the agent has any restrictions; false for admins and unrestricted agents, true for other agents

args.name: signature
args.info: The user's signature. Only agents and admins can have signatures

args.name: suspended
args.info: If the agent is suspended. Tickets from suspended users are also suspended, and these users cannot sign in to the end user portal

args.name: tags
args.info: The user's tags list. Only present if your account has user tagging enabled

args.name: ticketRestriction
args.info: Specifies which tickets the user has access to. Possible values are: "organization", "groups", "assigned", "requested", null

args.name: timeZone
args.info: The user's time zone. See Time Zone below

blocks.name: deleteAllSessions
blocks.description: Delete all session for current user

blocks.name: logout
blocks.description: Deletes the current session. In practice, this only works when using session auth for requests, such as client-side requests made from a Zendesk app. When using OAuth or basic authentication, you don't have a current session so this endpoint has no effect.

blocks.name: autocompleteOrganizations
blocks.description: Returns an array of organizations whose name starts with the value specified in the name parameter.

args.name: details
args.info: Any details obout the organization, such as the address

args.name: notes
args.info: Any notes you have about the organization

args.name: organizationFields
args.info: Custom fields for this organization. Example: ["org_dropdown": "option_1", "org_decimal": 5.2]

blocks.name: createOrganizationSubscription
blocks.description: Create organization subscription. End users can only subscribe to shared organizations in which they're members.

blocks.name: getListOrganizationSubscriptions
blocks.description: Get list of all organizations and subscriptions

blocks.name: getSingleOrganizationSubscriptions
blocks.description: Get list of all single organization subscriptions

blocks.name: getUserOrganizationSubscriptions
blocks.description: Get list of all user organization subscriptions

blocks.name: getListOrganizationMemberships
blocks.description: Get list of all organization memberships

blocks.name: getUserOrganizationMemberships
blocks.description: Get list of single user memberships

blocks.name: getSingleOrganizationMemberships
blocks.description: Get list of single organization memberships

blocks.name: deleteOrganizationMembershipsByIds
blocks.description: Immediately removes a user from a organization and schedules a job to unassign all working tickets that are assigned to the given user and organization combination

blocks.name: searchUsersByQuery
blocks.description: Specify a partial or full name or email address as the value of the query attribute. Example: query="Gerry". Specify an id number as the value of the external_id attribute. For more advanced searches of users, use the Search API.

blocks.name: updateUsersByIds
blocks.description: Update users with the same data

args.name: userIds
args.info: List of user IDs to update same data

args.name: params
args.info: Param to be updated to all users, which ids send. Example: {"organization_id": 1}

blocks.name: updateUsersByExternalIds
blocks.description: Update users with the same data

args.name: externalIds
args.info: List of user external IDs to update same data

args.name: params
args.info: Param to be updated to all users, which ids send. Example: {"organization_id": 1}

blocks.name: updateUsers
blocks.description: Update users with the different data by id or externalId

args.name: params
args.info: Param to be updated to all users, which ids send. Example:  [{ "id": 10071, "name": "New Name", "organization_id": 1 },{ "external_id": "123", "verified": true }]. In each element in array required id or externalId.

blocks.name: updateOrganizationsByIds
blocks.description: Update organization with the same data by id

args.name: params
args.info: Param to be updated to all users, which ids send. Example: {"notes": "Something interesting"}. In each element in array required id or externalId.

blocks.name: updateOrganizationsByExternalIds
blocks.description: Update organization with the same data by external id

args.name: params
args.info: Param to be updated to all users, which ids send. Example: {"notes": "Something interesting"}. In each element in array required id or externalId.

blocks.name: updateOrganizations
blocks.description: Update organization with the different data by id or external id

args.name: params
args.info: Param to be updated to all users, which ids send. Example: [{"id": 1, "notes": "Something interesting" },{ "external_id": "2", "notes": "Something even more interesting"}]. In each element in array required id or externalId.

blocks.name: createSearchQuery
blocks.description: The search API is a unified search API that returns tickets, users, and organizations. You can define filters to narrow your search results according to resource type, dates, and object properties, such as ticket requester or tag.

args.name: commentAuthorId
args.info: Author ID of comment. If not set, system use owner of apiToken

args.name: customFields
args.info: The fields and entries for this request

args.name: assigneeId
args.info: The id of the assignee if the field is visible to end users

args.name: groupId
args.info: The id of the assigned group if the field is visible to end users

args.name: collaboratorIds
args.info: Who are currently CC'ed on the ticket

args.name: isPublic
args.info: Is true if any comments are public, false otherwise

args.name: canBeSolvedByMe
args.info: If true, end user can mark request as solved.

args.name: solved
args.info: Whether or not request is solved (an end user can set this if "can_be_solved_by_me", above, is true for that user)

args.name: ticketFormId
args.info: The numeric id of the ticket form associated with this request if the form is visible to end users - only applicable for enterprise accounts

args.name: recipient
args.info: The original recipient e-mail address of the request

args.name: followupSourceId
args.info: The id of the original ticket if this request is a follow-up ticket

args.name: customFields
args.info: The fields and entries for this request

args.name: solved
args.info: Whether or not request is solved (an end user can set this if "can_be_solved_by_me", above, is true for that user)

args.name: ticketFormId
args.info: The numeric id of the ticket form associated with this request if the form is visible to end users - only applicable for enterprise accounts

args.name: recipient
args.info: The original recipient e-mail address of the request

blocks.name: getActions
blocks.description: Lists all automations for the current account

args.name: active
args.info: Only active automations if true, inactive automations if false

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Possible values are alphabetical, created_at, updated_at, usage_1h, usage_24h, or usage_7d. Defaults to position

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc or desc. Defaults to asc for alphabetical and position sort, desc for all others

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Possible values are alphabetical, created_at, updated_at, usage_1h, usage_24h, or usage_7d. Defaults to position

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc or desc. Defaults to asc for alphabetical and position sort, desc for all others

args.name: query
args.info: Query string used to find all automations with matching title

args.name: active
args.info: Only active automations if true, inactive automations if false

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Possible values are alphabetical, created_at, updated_at, and position. If unspecified, the automations are sorted by relevance

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc or desc. Defaults to asc for alphabetical and position sort, desc for all others

blocks.name: getMacrosList
blocks.description: Lists all shared and personal macros available to the current user.

args.name: access
args.info: Only macros with given access. Possible values are personal, shared, or account

args.name: active
args.info: Only active macros if true, inactive macros if false

args.name: groupId
args.info: Only macros belonging to given group

args.name: onlyViewable
args.info: Only macros that can be applied to tickets if true, All macros the current user can manage if false. Defaults to false

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Possible values are alphabetical, created_at, updated_at, usage_1h, usage_24h, or usage_7d. Defaults to alphabetical

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc or desc. Defaults to asc for alphabetical and position sort, desc for all others

blocks.name: getActiveMacros
blocks.description: Lists all active shared and personal macros available to the current user.

args.name: access
args.info: Only macros with given access. Possible values are personal, shared, or account

args.name: groupId
args.info: Only macros belonging to given group

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Possible values are alphabetical, created_at, updated_at, usage_1h, usage_24h, or usage_7d. Defaults to alphabetical

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc or desc. Defaults to asc for alphabetical and position sort, desc for all others

args.name: active
args.info: Useful for determining if the macro should be displayed

args.name: actions
args.info: An object describing what the macro will do. Example: { "field": "status", "value": "solved" }

structure.name: field
structure.info: The name of a ticket field to modify

structure.name: value
structure.info: The new value of the field

args.name: restriction
args.info: Who may access this macro. Will be null when everyone in the account can access it

structure.name: type
structure.info: Allowed values are Group or User

structure.name: id
structure.info: The numeric ID of the group or user

structure.name: ids
structure.info: The numeric IDs of the groups (comma or list ?)

args.name: active
args.info: Useful for determining if the macro should be displayed

args.name: actions
args.info: An object describing what the macro will do. Example: { "field": "status", "value": "solved" }

structure.name: field
structure.info: The name of a ticket field to modify

structure.name: value
structure.info: The new value of the field

args.name: restriction
args.info: Who may access this macro. Will be null when everyone in the account can access it

structure.name: type
structure.info: Allowed values are Group or User

structure.name: id
structure.info: The numeric ID of the group or user

structure.name: ids
structure.info: The numeric IDs of the groups (comma or list ?)

blocks.name: showChangesToTicket
blocks.description: Returns the changes the macro would make to a ticket. It doesn't actually change a ticket. You can use the response data in a subsequent API call to the Tickets endpoint to update the ticket. The response includes only the ticket fields that would be changed by the macro. To get the full ticket object after the macro is applied, see Show Ticket After Changes below.

blocks.name: showTicketAfterChanges
blocks.description: Returns the full ticket object as it would be after applying the macro to the ticket. It doesn't actually change the ticket. You can use the response data in a subsequent API call to the Tickets endpoint to update the ticket. To get only the ticket fields that would be changed by the macro, see Show Changes to Ticket.

blocks.name: getMacroCategories
blocks.description: Lists all macro categories available to the current user.

args.name: query
args.info: Query string used to find macros with matching titles

args.name: access
args.info: List macros with the given access. Possible values are personal, shared, or account

args.name: active
args.info: List active macros if true; inactive macros if false

args.name: category
args.info: List macros in the given category

args.name: groupId
args.info: List macros belonging to given group

args.name: onlyViewable
args.info: List macros that can be applied to tickets if true; list all macros the current user can manage if false. Default is false

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Possible values are alphabetical, created_at, updated_at, and position. If unspecified, the macros are sorted by relevance

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc or desc. Defaults to asc for alphabetical and position sort, desc for all others

blocks.name: showMacroReplica
blocks.description: Returns an unpersisted macro representation derived from a ticket or macro.

args.name: macroId
args.info: ID of the macro to replicate. You must pass this value or ticketId

args.name: ticketId
args.info: ID of the ticket from which to build a macro replica. You must pass this value or macroId

blocks.name: getSLAPolicies
blocks.description: Get Service Level Agreements. Accounts on the Professional and Enterprise plans

blocks.name: getSupportedFilterDefinitionItems
blocks.description: Retrieve supported filter definition items. Accounts on the Professional and Enterprise plans only

blocks.name: getTargets
blocks.description: Targets are pointers to cloud-based applications and services such as Twitter and Twilio, as well as to HTTP and email addresses. You can use targets with triggers and automations to send a notification to the target when a ticket is created or updated.

blocks.name: getTriggers
blocks.description: Lists all triggers for the current account

args.name: active
args.info: Only active triggers if true, inactive triggers if false

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Possible values are alphabetical, created_at, updated_at, usage_1h, usage_24h, or usage_7d. Defaults to position

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc or desc. Defaults to asc for alphabetical and position sort, desc for all others

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Possible values are alphabetical, created_at, updated_at, usage_1h, usage_24h, or usage_7d. Defaults to position

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc or desc. Defaults to asc for alphabetical and position sort, desc for all others

blocks.name: searchTriggers
blocks.description: Search triggers by query in title

args.name: query
args.info: Query string used to find all triggers with matching title

args.name: active
args.info: Only active triggers if true, inactive triggers if false

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Possible values are alphabetical, created_at, updated_at, and position. If unspecified, the triggers are sorted by relevance

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc or desc. Defaults to asc for alphabetical and position sort, desc for all others

blocks.name: getViews
blocks.description: Lists shared and personal Views available to the current user

args.name: access
args.info: Only views with given access. May be personal, shared, or account

args.name: active
args.info: Only active views if true, inactive views if false

args.name: groupId
args.info: Only views belonging to given group

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Possible values are alphabetical, created_at, or updated_at. Defaults to position

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc or desc. Defaults to asc for alphabetical and position sort, desc for all others

blocks.name: getActiveViews
blocks.description: Lists active shared and personal Views available to the current user

args.name: access
args.info: Only views with given access. May be personal, shared, or account

args.name: groupId
args.info: Only views belonging to given group

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Possible values are alphabetical, created_at, or updated_at. Defaults to position

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc or desc. Defaults to asc for alphabetical and position sort, desc for all others

args.name: viewId
args.info: A view consists of one or more conditions that define a collection of tickets to display.

args.name: viewData
args.info: A view consists of one or more conditions that define a collection of tickets to display.

args.name: viewData
args.info: A view consists of one or more conditions that define a collection of tickets to display.

blocks.name: executeView
blocks.description: You execute a view in order to get the tickets that fulfill the conditions of the view.

blocks.name: getViewsCounts
blocks.description: Calculates the size of the view in terms of number of tickets the view will return. Only returns values for personal and shared views accessible to the user performing the request.

blocks.name: getSingleViewCount
blocks.description: Returns the ticket count for a single view.

blocks.name: exportViews
blocks.description: Returns the csv attachment of the current view if possible. Enqueues job to produce the csv if necessary

args.name: query
args.info: Query string used to find all views with matching title

args.name: access
args.info: Only views with given access. May be personal, shared, or account

args.name: active
args.info: Only active views if true, inactive views if false

args.name: groupId
args.info: Only views belonging to given group

args.name: sortBy
args.info: Possible values are alphabetical, created_at, updated_at, and position. If unspecified, the views are sorted by relevance

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: One of asc or desc. Defaults to asc for alphabetical and position sort, desc for all other

blocks.name: getAccountSettings
blocks.description: Shows the settings that are available for the account.

blocks.name: updateAccountSettings
blocks.description: Updates settings for the account. See JSON Format from getAccountSettings for the settings you can update.

blocks.name: getBrands
blocks.description: Returns a list of all brands for your account sorted by name.

args.name: hasHelpCenter
args.info: If the brand has a Help Center

args.name: active
args.info: If the brand is set as active

args.name: default
args.info: Is the brand the default brand for this account

args.name: subdomain
args.info: The subdomain of the brand (only admins view this key)

args.name: hostMapping
args.info: The hostmapping to this brand, if any (only admins view this key)

args.name: signatureTemplate
args.info: The signature template for a brand

args.name: hasHelpCenter

args.name: subdomain

args.name: hostMapping
args.info: The hostmapping to this brand, if any (only admins view this key)

args.name: signatureTemplate
args.info: The signature template for a brand

blocks.name: checkHostMappingValidity
blocks.description: Returns a JSON object determining whether a host mapping is valid for a given subdomain.

args.name: hostMapping
args.info: The hostmapping to this brand, if any (only admins view this key)

args.name: subdomain
args.info: The subdomain of the brand (only admins view this key)

blocks.name: updateDefaultBrand
blocks.description: The default brand is the one that tickets get assigned to if the ticket is generated from a non-branded channel. You can update the default brand using the updateAccountSettings endpoint.

args.name: brandId
args.info: Brand ID to set as default

blocks.name: getLocales
blocks.description: This lists the translation locales that are available for the account.

blocks.name: getOrganizationFields
blocks.description: Returns a list of all custom Organization Fields in your account. Fields are returned in the order that you specify in your Organization Fields configuration in Zendesk Support. Clients should cache this resource for the duration of their API usage and map the key for each Organization.

blocks.name: getSingleOrganizationField
blocks.description: Get single organization field by ID

args.name: key
args.info: A unique key that identifies this custom field. This is used for updating the field and referencing in placeholders.

args.name: type
args.info: Type of the custom field: "checkbox", "date", "decimal", "dropdown", "integer", "regexp", "text", or "textarea"

args.name: title
args.info: The title of the custom field

args.name: rawTitle
args.info: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "title" value, if not. See dynamic content at Zendesk Core API -> Dynamic Content

args.name: description
args.info: User-defined description of this field's purpose

args.name: rawDescription
args.info: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "description" value, if not. See dynamic content at Zendesk Core API -> Dynamic Content

args.name: position
args.info: Ordering of the field relative to other fields

args.name: active
args.info: If true, this field is available for use

args.name: regexpForValidation
args.info: Regular expression field only. The validation pattern for a field value to be deemed valid.

args.name: tag
args.info: Optional for custom field of type "checkbox"; not presented otherwise.

args.name: customFieldOptions
args.info: Required and presented for a custom field of type "dropdown"

structure.name: id

args.info: Required and presented for a custom field of type "dropdown". All options must be passed on update. Options that are not passed will be removed; as a result, these values will be removed from any organizations. To re-order an option, reposition it in the custom_field_options array relative to the other options. To remove an option, omit it from the list of options upon update

args.name: intervals

args.name: default
args.info: Whether the address is the account's default support address

blocks.name: verifySupportAddressForwarding
blocks.description: Sends a test email to the specified support address to verify that email forwarding for the address works. An external support address won't work in Zendesk Support until it's verified. Note: You don't need to verify Zendesk support addresses.

args.name: type
args.info: The endpoint takes only this parametr: "forwarding"

blocks.name: getTicketForms
blocks.description: Returns a list of all ticket forms for your account if accessed as an admin or agent. End users will only see the list of ticket forms that are marked 'end_user_visible'.

args.name: active
args.info: Only active ticket forms if true, inactive ticket forms if false. Active and inactive ticket forms if not present.

args.name: endUserVisible
args.info: Only ticket forms marked 'end_user_visible' if true, ticket forms marked non 'end_user_visible' if false. End user and non end user visible if not present.

args.name: fallbackToDefault
args.info: If true, returns default ticket form when the criteria defined by the parameters results in a set without active and end user visible ticket forms.

args.name: associatedToBrand
args.info: Only ticket forms of current brand (defined by url) if true

args.name: rawName
args.info: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "name" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

args.name: display_name
args.info: The name of the form that is displayed to an end user

args.name: rawDisplayName
args.info: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "display_name" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

args.name: position
args.info: The position of this form among other forms in the account, i.e. dropdown

args.name: active
args.info: If the form is set as active

args.name: endUserVisible
args.info: Is the form visible to the end user

args.name: default
args.info: Is the form the default form for this account

args.name: ticketFieldIds
args.info: List ids of all ticket fields which are in this ticket form

args.name: inAllBrands
args.info: Is the form available for use in all brands on this account

args.name: restrictedBrandIds
args.info: List ids of all brands that this ticket form is restricted to

args.name: inAllOrganizations
args.info: Is the form available for use in all organizations on this account

args.name: restrictedOrganizationIds
args.info: List ids of all organizations that this ticket form is restricted to

args.name: rawName
args.info: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "name" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

args.name: display_name
args.info: The name of the form that is displayed to an end user

args.name: rawDisplayName
args.info: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "display_name" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

args.name: position
args.info: The position of this form among other forms in the account, i.e. dropdown

args.info: If the form is set as active

args.name: endUserVisible
args.info: Is the form visible to the end user

args.name: default
args.info: Is the form the default form for this account

args.name: ticketFieldIds
args.info: List ids of all ticket fields which are in this ticket form

args.name: type
args.info: The type of the ticket field: "checkbox", "date", "decimal", "integer", "regexp", "tagger", "text", or "textarea".

args.name: title
args.info: The title of the ticket field

args.name: rawTitle
args.info: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "title" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

args.name: description
args.info: The description of the purpose of this ticket field, shown to users

args.name: rawDescription
args.info: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "description" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

args.name: position
args.info: A relative position for the ticket fields that determines the order of ticket fields on a ticket. Note that positions 0 to 7 are reserved for system fields

args.name: required
args.info: If it's required for this field to have a value when updated by agents

args.name: collapsedForAgents
args.info: If this field should be shown to agents by default or be hidden alongside infrequently used fields. Classic interface only

args.name: regexpForValidation
args.info: Regular expression field only. The validation pattern for a field value to be deemed valid.

args.name: titleInPortal
args.info: The title of the ticket field when shown to end users

args.name: rawTitleInPortal
args.info: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "title_in_portal" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

args.name: visibleInPortal
args.info: Whether this field is available to end users

args.name: editableInPortal
args.info: Whether this field is editable by end users

args.name: requiredInPortal
args.info: If it's required for this field to have a value when updated by end users

args.name: tag
args.info: A tag value to set for checkbox fields when checked

args.name: customFieldOptions
args.info: Required and presented for a ticket field of type "tagger". Example: ["name": "Pineapples", "value": 3 }, {...}]

blocks.name: getUserFieldOptions
blocks.description: Get list of user field options

blocks.name: uploadAppPackage
blocks.description: Uploads a new app package to Zendesk Support.

blocks.name: getJobStatus
blocks.description: Gets the application build job status. You must provide the job id returned when the job was created.

blocks.name: createApp
blocks.description: Adds a build of a new app to the job queue.

blocks.name: updateApp
blocks.description: Adds a build of a new app to the job queue.

blocks.name: getAppInfo
blocks.description: Retrieves information about the specified app accessible to the current user and account.

blocks.name: getOwnedApps
blocks.description: Lists apps owned by the current account.

blocks.name: getAllApps
blocks.description: Lists all private and public apps, including Marketplace apps.

blocks.name: sendNotificationToApp
blocks.description: Sends messages to currently open instances of an app. The messages cause a notification event to fire in the app. See Notification events in the ZAF v1 docs. For example, you could send a message to all signed-in agents telling them to take the day off. Note: When developing with the Zendesk App Tools, you can send messages to your unpublished app by setting the app_id parameter to 0.

args.name: appId
args.info: The id of the app you want to send the message to

args.name: event
args.info: The name of the event you want to fire in your app

args.name: body
args.info: If it's valid JSON, it's passed to your app as a JavaScript object.

args.name: agentId
args.info: Send the notification to only one agent

blocks.name: deleteApp
blocks.description: Deletes the specified app and removes it from the Manage pages in Zendesk Support.

args.name: appId
args.info: The id of the app you want to send the message to

blocks.name: getAppInstallations
blocks.description: Lists all app installations in the account. The enabled property indicates whether or not the installed app is active in the product.

args.name: include
args.info: You can pass app as a parameter to side-load the app object associated with each installation.

blocks.name: installApp
blocks.description: Installs an app in the account.

blocks.name: showAppInstallation
blocks.description: Retrieves information about the specified app installation, including the installation settings.

blocks.name: getRequirementsInstallStatus
blocks.description: If a job has kicked off to install an app and the app has requirements, this endpoint returns the status of the requirements installation. The job id is supplied in the response to the app installation request.

blocks.name: getRequirements
blocks.description: Lists all app requirements for an installation.

blocks.name: reorderAppInstallations
blocks.description: Creates or updates the relevant location installation with a specified installation order. When implementing this API in response to a user reordering installations, ensure you throttle your API calls to a reasonable limit.

blocks.name: getLocations
blocks.description: Returns a list of available locations for Zendesk apps.

args.name: identifier
args.info: The unique identifier for this client

args.name: userId
args.info: The id of the admin who created the client

args.name: company
args.info: Choose a company name to display when users are asked to approve access to your application. The name will help users understand who they are granting access to.

args.name: description
args.info: A short description of your client that is displayed to users when they are considering approving access to your application.

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: An array of the valid redirect URIs for this client

args.name: identifier
args.info: The unique identifier for this client

args.name: userId
args.info: The id of the admin who created the client

args.name: company
args.info: Choose a company name to display when users are asked to approve access to your application. The name will help users understand who they are granting access to.

args.name: description
args.info: A short description of your client that is displayed to users when they are considering approving access to your application.

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: An array of the valid redirect URIs for this client

args.name: clientId
args.info: The numeric ID of the client this token belongs to

args.name: scopes
args.info: List of scopes. users, auditlogs (read only), organizations, hc, apps, triggers, automations, targets, macros, requests, satisfaction_ratings, dynamic_content, any_channel (write only), web_widget (write only). Example: read, write, users:write, tickets:read etc.

blocks.name: getAuthorizedGlobalClients
blocks.description: This returns all the global clients that users on your account have authorized.

blocks.name: getStreamActivities
blocks.description: Lists activities pertaining to the user performing the request.

blocks.name: unregisterPushNotificationDevices
blocks.description: Unregisters the mobile devices that are receiving push notifications. Specify the devices as an array of mobile device tokens.

blocks.name: getResourceCollections
blocks.description: Lists all resource collections that have been created.

blocks.name: getSingleResourceCollection
blocks.description: Retrieves details of a specified resource collection.

blocks.name: getPopularTags
blocks.description: Lists the most popular recent tags in decreasing popularity

blocks.name: autocompleteTags
blocks.description: Returns an array of registered and recent tag names that start with the specified name. The name must be at least 2 characters in length.

blocks.name: updateBrandImage
blocks.description: A brand image can be updated by uploading a local file using the update brand endpoint.
